comment: keep blocks.RedstoneHitboxMixin as the first mixin listed here.
it checks if malilib exists, and if not show a message and throw.
this is necessary because mixins get loaded before RedstoneToolsClient#onInitializeClient().
RedstoneHitboxMixin is the first mixin listed here, so it gets loaded first.
Other mixins (including this one) use malilib classes before onInitializeClient() gets run.
So, if malilib isn't present, the mixins will throw a ClassNotFoundException and we never
get to display the message telling the user to install malilib.
